channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz wins his 2nd U.S. Open at match delayed by Trump's attendance
item.description: The president's arrival delayed the match and left many ticketholders waiting in line. He watched from Rolex's luxury box.

item.title: Australian Woman, Erin Patterson, Gets Life in Mushroom Murder Case
item.description: Erin Patterson was found guilty of murdering three of her husband’s relatives and trying to kill a fourth by serving them deadly mushrooms.

item.title: More than 90,000 Jeep Grand Cherokees recalled over potential loss of drive power
item.description: Vehicles impacted by the recall include 2022 to 2026 plug-in hybrid electric models of the Jeep Grand Cherokee.

item.title: West Point Alumni Group Cancels Award Honoring Tom Hanks
item.description: The group was to bestow the Sylvanus Thayer Award on the actor, but it said it was canceling the event to focus on preparing academy cadets for the fu...

item.title: Wildfire Fighters, Unmasked in Toxic Smoke, Are Getting Sick and Dying
item.description: The U.S. Forest Service has fought decades of efforts to better protect its crews — sending them into smoke without masks or warnings about the risks.

item.title: Australian Woman, Erin Patterson, Gets Life in Mushroom Murder Case
item.description: Erin Patterson was found guilty of murdering three of her husband’s relatives and trying to kill a fourth by serving them deadly mushrooms.

item.title: Millions of Londoners Brace for Transit Disruption as Tube Strike Begins
item.description: A strike on the London Underground began Sunday over pay and conditions, threatening to upend commuter journeys for most of the week.

item.title: Colombia's lone Amazon port faces drying river and rising tensions with Peru
item.description: Colombia's only Amazon port town could soon be cut off from the river that keeps it alive. As drought and a shifting river spark a tense border disput...

item.title: Postal traffic to US drops more than 80% after trade exemption rule ends, UN agency says
item.description: The de minimis rule that allowed small packages worth less than $800 to be exempt from tariffs ended on Friday, Aug. 29, 2025.

item.title: Trump walks back Chicago 'war' threat, but vows to 'clean up' cities
item.description: Trump posted online that Chicago was "about to find out why it's called the Department of WAR," but later said his administration wouldn't go to war w...

item.title: Millions of Londoners Brace for Transit Disruption as Tube Strike Begins
item.description: A strike on the London Underground began Sunday over pay and conditions, threatening to upend commuter journeys for most of the week.

item.title: A View From Inside Iran
item.description: Our correspondent found a sense of apprehension in the country after the 12-day war with Israel.

item.title: Trump Is Met With Mostly Boos at U.S. Open as Security Delays a Match
item.description: With the president in attendance at Arthur Ashe Stadium, the men’s final began as hundreds of people were still waiting to go through security screeni...

item.title: Brazilians Protest as Bolsonaro Coup Trial Nears Verdict
item.description: Tensions are heating up in Brazil as the nation enters the final week of former President Jair Bolsonaro’s trial on attempted coup charges.

item.title: American Pilot Ethan Guo Is Released After Being Stuck Off Antarctica
item.description: Ethan Guo said that he had been effectively stranded at a Chilean military base on King George Island since June 28. The authorities said he landed wi...
